DOC.brief_summary: The aim is to study the effect of local anaesthesia (EMLAÂ®) on pain associated with sterile water injections.
DOC.brief_title: EMLA and Sterile Water Injections - Pain From Injections
DOC.detailed_description: Sterile Water Injection (SWI) was previously shown to give good pain relief for lower-back pain during childbirth, chronic neck pain and ureterolithiasis. However, the pain associated with the injections remains problematic, and therefore it is important to find a less painful injection technique.
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Woman Age 1845 years Healthy Ability to understand information and instructions Pregnancy Previous experience of SWI Ongoing pain Use of medication for depression, pain, or sleeping disorder 24 hours prior to the experiment Smoking, snuffing, physical activity, and intake of caffeinated beverages (coffee, tea, or energy drink (e.g., Red Bull) 2 hours prior to the experiment
